thread.title: Labour targets Devon seat in plan for early election

author: Keith Rossiter
title: Labour targets Devon seat in plan for early election
text:
Labour targets Devon seat in plan for early election There will be a candidate within three months Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Comments 
Three Westcountry parliamentary seats are on a leaked list of 75 key marginals Labour is targeting. 
Camborne and Redruth, Plymouth Moor View, and Truro and Falmouth are among the marginals expected to select their prospective candidates this autumn. 
The website LabourList said Jeremy Corbyn aims to reclaim a series of a Middle England seats by installing prospective parliamentary candidates in the coming three months in preparation for an early general election. 
As Labour activists gathered in Brighton for their annual conference, Mr Corbyn said June’s general election, which saw Labour gain 30 seats as Theresa May lost her majority, had “changed politics in this country”. Read More Ex-Cabinet minister urges Corbyn to reclaim St George’s flag to woo Brexiteers and Tory voters 
Mr Corbyn said: “We are now the mainstream. The Government lacks any sense of direction.” 
He said Labour was already selecting candidates in key seats and putting detailed policy papers together for an early poll. 
Mr Corbyn’s party picked the only low-hanging fruit in the Westcountry in June this year, when Oliver Colvile lost his marginal seat of Plymouth Sutton and Devonport to Labour’s Luke Pollard. 
Mr Pollard said yesterday that Labour had increased its vote across the Westcountry in June and “anything is possible”. 
“It’s great to have three target seats in the South West,” he said. “More attention on the region is long overdue. I would expect us to have more South West-specific policies. Read More Ben Bradshaw: Why I have completely changed my mind over Jeremy Corbyn 
“We’re selecting seats now because we think the government doesn’t have the stability or leadership to last a full parliament. They have lost their way on Brexit, transport and policing.” 
During the summer, party headquarters began to contact constituency Labour parties to ask if they wished to have an all-women shortlist. 
Two of the three Westcountry target seats are understood to have opted for all-women lists. In June Tory MP Johnny Mercer increased his margin in the Plymouth Moor View constituency, with 52% of the vote, 5,019 votes ahead of Labour. Read More
